parameters.name: action1

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: Default action if no cases match

examples: switch(%0, hello, Hi there!, goodbye, Bye!, I don't understand.)

name: Comma Formatting Function
description: Formats numbers with comma separators for readability
codeTemplate: &FUNCTION-COMMA {{object}}=switch(1, and(or(strmatch(%0,-\*), strmatch(%0,+\*)), isnum(%0)), [left(%0,1)][u(me/u-comma, before(trim(abs(%0)), .))][switch(abs(%0), \*.\*, .[after(trim(abs(%0)), .)])], isnum(%0), [u(me/u-comma, before(trim(%0), .))][switch(%0, \*.\*, .[after(trim(%0), .)])], #-1 FUNCTION COMMA EXPECTS A NUMBER)
examples: u(comma-obj/function-comma, 1234) -> 1,234
u(comma-obj/function-comma, -51234.56) -> -51,234.56

name: FN_CHECK_OBJECT_FOR_COMMAND Function
codeTemplate: &FN_CHECK_OBJECT_FOR_COMMAND Whence command object=if( not( orflags( %0, nhG )), trim( squish( iter( setdiff( lcstr( lattrp( %0 )), lcstr( get( %va/list_never_check ))), strcat( setq( f, lflags( %0/%i0 )), setq( v, get( %0/%i0 )), switch( 1, match( %qf, NO_COMMAND ), , and( match( %qf, HIDDEN ), not( orflags( %#, WZ ))), , and( match( %qf, PRIVATE ), not( or( orflags( %#, W ), strmatch( owner( %0/%i0 ), %# )))), , not( regmatch( %qv, ^%[$%](%[^:%]+):, -1 m )), , match( %qf, REGEXP ), if( match( %qf, CASE ), if( regmatchi( %1, %qm ), %0/%i0 ), if( regmatch( %1, %qm ), %0/%i0 )), strmatch( %1, %qm ), %0/%i0 ))))))
examples: &FN_CHECK_OBJECT_FOR_COMMAND Whence command object=if( not( orflags( %0, nhG )), trim( squish( iter( setdiff( lcstr( lattrp( %0 )), lcstr( get( %va/list_never_check ))), strcat( setq( f, lflags( %0/%i0 )), setq( v, get( %0/%i0 )), switch( 1, match( %qf, NO_COMMAND ), , and( match( %qf, HIDDEN ), not( orflags( %#, WZ ))), , and( match( %qf, PRIVATE ), not( or( orflags( %#, W ), strmatch( owner( %0/%i0 ), %# )))), , not( regmatch( %qv, ^%[$%](%[^:%]+):, -1 m )), , match( %qf, REGEXP ), if( match( %qf, CASE ), if( regmatchi( %1, %qm ), %0/%i0 ), if( regmatch( %1, %qm ), %0/%i0 )), strmatch( %1, %qm ), %0/%i0 ))))))

name: N_ST Function
codeTemplate: &N_ST #data-help=Show the Storytellers & Staff||%b[ansi(hw,+st)]%R%b[ansi(hw,+staff)]%R%R%b%xc+st%xn and %xc+staff%xn will show you all the %xhStorytellers%xn and %xhCore Staff%xn of the game, along with their positions.%R%R * %xhDirectors%xn - Each Director takes care of a specific creature sphere - Mortals, Mages, Vampires etc. %xhDirectors are not IC characters.%xn%R%R * %xhSubdirectors%xn - These people are Directors with responsibility for specific factions within a sphere. %xhSubdirectors are not IC characters.%xn%R%R * %xhProducers%xn - The Producers are %xhhired by the Directors%xn to delegate tasks to. Inspecting player builds, running sub-plots, handling specific NPCs, etc. %xhProducers are usually IC characters.%xn%R%R * %xhStaff%xn - The Core Staff of the MUSH takes care of the website, the server, %xhhiring Directors and Subdirectors%xn, writing code and fixing bugs. %xhCore Staff are not IC characters.%xn%r%r For more information about our staff structure, we %xh%xrstrongly%xn suggest reading %xc+bbread 2/1%xn!%R
examples: &N_ST #data-help=Show the Storytellers & Staff||%b[ansi(hw,+st)]%R%b[ansi(hw,+staff)]%R%R%b%xc+st%xn and %xc+staff%xn will show you all the %xhStorytellers%xn and %xhCore Staff%xn of the game, along with their positions.%R%R * %xhDirectors%xn - Each Director takes care of a specific creature sphere - Mortals, Mages, Vampires etc. %xhDirectors are not IC characters.%xn%R%R * %xhSubdirectors%xn - These people are Directors with responsibility for specific factions within a sphere. %xhSubdirectors are not IC characters.%xn%R%R * %xhProducers%xn - The Producers are %xhhired by the Directors%xn to delegate tasks to. Inspecting player builds, running sub-plots, handling specific NPCs, etc. %xhProducers are usually IC characters.%xn%R%R * %xhStaff%xn - The Core Staff of the MUSH takes care of the website, the server, %xhhiring Directors and Subdirectors%xn, writing code and fixing bugs. %xhCore Staff are not IC characters.%xn%r%r For more information about our staff structure, we %xh%xrstrongly%xn suggest reading %xc+bbread 2/1%xn!%R

name: V_HANGOUT Function
codeTemplate: &V_HANGOUT #data-help=Jump to Grid hangouts||%b%xh%xrAliases for +hangout are +hideout, +hotspot, +dir, +directory, +yp and +yellowpages. Plural also works.%xn%R%b%xh+hangout\[/all\]%R%b+hangout/type%R%b+hangout/type <category>%R%b+hangout <number or name>%R%b+hangout\[/jump /tel /join /visit\] <number or name>%xn%R%R%TThe %xc+hangout%xn command allows you to view a list of hangout spots and landmarks in any reality your character can see. You may not jump/teleport across reality levels.%R%R%T%xc+hangout / +hangout/all%xn - This shows you the list of hangouts that your character can see.%xh Hangouts marked with a %xn%xh%xr*%xn%xh are restricted%xn, but your character can visit them due to their affiliation. Unaffiliated characters won't see the entry in the list.%R%R%TThe %xc/all%xn switch makes it so you even see hangouts that currently have no visitors at that location.%R%R%TThe %xc/type%xn switch allows you to specify a %xycategory%xn of hangsouts you want to see. Valid categories are: [elist(get(#hangouts/categories),,,,,%xc%0%xn)].%R%tIf you simply type %xc+hangout/type%xn it will show this list. %R%R%T%xc+hangout <number> / +hangout/list <number or name>%xn - This shows the entry for one specific hangout, in case the description got cut off in the general list.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/jump <number or name>%xn - This instantly carries you to that hangout if you share its reality. %xyNote:%xn This is %xh%xrNOT%xn an IC method of transportation. It is simply for OOC convenience. %xhAliases for %xn%xc/jump%xn are %xhlisted above%xn.%R
examples: &V_HANGOUT #data-help=Jump to Grid hangouts||%b%xh%xrAliases for +hangout are +hideout, +hotspot, +dir, +directory, +yp and +yellowpages. Plural also works.%xn%R%b%xh+hangout\[/all\]%R%b+hangout/type%R%b+hangout/type <category>%R%b+hangout <number or name>%R%b+hangout\[/jump /tel /join /visit\] <number or name>%xn%R%R%TThe %xc+hangout%xn command allows you to view a list of hangout spots and landmarks in any reality your character can see. You may not jump/teleport across reality levels.%R%R%T%xc+hangout / +hangout/all%xn - This shows you the list of hangouts that your character can see.%xh Hangouts marked with a %xn%xh%xr*%xn%xh are restricted%xn, but your character can visit them due to their affiliation. Unaffiliated characters won't see the entry in the list.%R%R%TThe %xc/all%xn switch makes it so you even see hangouts that currently have no visitors at that location.%R%R%TThe %xc/type%xn switch allows you to specify a %xycategory%xn of hangsouts you want to see. Valid categories are: [elist(get(#hangouts/categories),,,,,%xc%0%xn)].%R%tIf you simply type %xc+hangout/type%xn it will show this list. %R%R%T%xc+hangout <number> / +hangout/list <number or name>%xn - This shows the entry for one specific hangout, in case the description got cut off in the general list.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/jump <number or name>%xn - This instantly carries you to that hangout if you share its reality. %xyNote:%xn This is %xh%xrNOT%xn an IC method of transportation. It is simply for OOC convenience. %xhAliases for %xn%xc/jump%xn are %xhlisted above%xn.%R

name: A_HANGOUT Function
codeTemplate: &A_HANGOUT #data-help=Administrative +hangout||%b%xh+hangout/add <category>/<tag>=<description>%R%b+hangout/remove <number>%R%b+hangout/addtag <number>=<tag>%R%b+hangout/removetag <number>=<tag>%R%b+hangout/listtags <number>%R%b+hangout/addcategory <number>=<category>%R%b+hangout/removecategory <number>=<category>%R%b+hangout/listcateogries <number>%R%b+hangout/redesc <number>=<desc>%R%b+hangout/addroom <number>%R%b+hangout/removeroom <number>%R%b+hangout/cleanup%xn%R%R%t%xc+hangout/add <category>/<tag>=<description>%xn - adds a +hangout entry for your current location, in the reality you are currently in/can see. %xc<category>%xn should be one of [elist(get(#HANGOUTS/CATEGORIES),,,,,%xc[caplist(lcstr(edit(%0,_,%b)))]%xn)].%R%R%TThe %xc<tag>%xn should correspond to one of your managed factions/subfactions/types (you will get a list if invalid). Public hangouts use the tag '%xyall%xn'.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/remove <number>%xn - this will remove one of the hangouts from the current reality's list of hangouts.%R%R%t%xc+hangout/addtag <number>=<tag>%xn - This adds a tag to a hangout. Note: If a hangout is tagged '%xyall%xn' and you wish to restrict it, add a tag, then %xcremovetag%xn the %xyall%xn tag.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/removetag <number>=<tag>%xn - Removes additional tags that you have added. Note: You can't remove all tags of a hangout. Add the %xyall%xn tag before removing all specific ones.%R%R%TThe %xc/addcategory%xn and %xc/removecategory%xn switches are the category analogs for adding and removing categories from a hangout.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/listtags <number>%xn - Lists all tags currently set on a hangout.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/redesc <number>=<description>%xn - Changes the description of a hangout.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/addroom <number>%xn - This adds the room you are currently in to a +hangout. This does not show the room in the hangouts list, but adds its inhabitants to the total amount of players displayed present in the hangout. %xc/removeroom <number>%xn to remove the room again from the hangout.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/cleanup%xn - Cleans your current reality's list of hangouts from invalid entries.%R
examples: &A_HANGOUT #data-help=Administrative +hangout||%b%xh+hangout/add <category>/<tag>=<description>%R%b+hangout/remove <number>%R%b+hangout/addtag <number>=<tag>%R%b+hangout/removetag <number>=<tag>%R%b+hangout/listtags <number>%R%b+hangout/addcategory <number>=<category>%R%b+hangout/removecategory <number>=<category>%R%b+hangout/listcateogries <number>%R%b+hangout/redesc <number>=<desc>%R%b+hangout/addroom <number>%R%b+hangout/removeroom <number>%R%b+hangout/cleanup%xn%R%R%t%xc+hangout/add <category>/<tag>=<description>%xn - adds a +hangout entry for your current location, in the reality you are currently in/can see. %xc<category>%xn should be one of [elist(get(#HANGOUTS/CATEGORIES),,,,,%xc[caplist(lcstr(edit(%0,_,%b)))]%xn)].%R%R%TThe %xc<tag>%xn should correspond to one of your managed factions/subfactions/types (you will get a list if invalid). Public hangouts use the tag '%xyall%xn'.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/remove <number>%xn - this will remove one of the hangouts from the current reality's list of hangouts.%R%R%t%xc+hangout/addtag <number>=<tag>%xn - This adds a tag to a hangout. Note: If a hangout is tagged '%xyall%xn' and you wish to restrict it, add a tag, then %xcremovetag%xn the %xyall%xn tag.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/removetag <number>=<tag>%xn - Removes additional tags that you have added. Note: You can't remove all tags of a hangout. Add the %xyall%xn tag before removing all specific ones.%R%R%TThe %xc/addcategory%xn and %xc/removecategory%xn switches are the category analogs for adding and removing categories from a hangout.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/listtags <number>%xn - Lists all tags currently set on a hangout.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/redesc <number>=<description>%xn - Changes the description of a hangout.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/addroom <number>%xn - This adds the room you are currently in to a +hangout. This does not show the room in the hangouts list, but adds its inhabitants to the total amount of players displayed present in the hangout. %xc/removeroom <number>%xn to remove the room again from the hangout.%R%R%T%xc+hangout/cleanup%xn - Cleans your current reality's list of hangouts from invalid entries.%R

name: C_NOTES Function
codeTemplate: &C_NOTES #data-help=Set Character Notes//%xn%xrAn alias for +note is +notes - the 's' is always optional%xn%r%r The notes system is to allow you and storytellers to keep and share important%r information about your character, keeping them sorted in various pre-set%r categories.%r%r %xcREAD NOTES%xn%r%b %b%xh+notes%xn[space(22)]- see all your notes%r%b %b%xh+note <note name or number>%xn - see your note%r%b %b%xh+note/<category>%xn[space(12)]- see all your notes in a category%r%b %b%xh+notedecompile <note(s)>%xn %b %b- get the raw text that created the note.%r%r%b %b%xh+note <target>/*%xn[space(12)]- see all visible notes on someone else%r%b %b%xh+note <target>/<note>%xn[space(7)]- see a note on someone else%r%b %b%xh+note/<category> <target>/*%xn - see all notes on someone else in a category%r%r %xcMAKE NOTES%xn%r%b %b%xh+note <name>=<text>%xn[space(12)]- make a note called <name>%r%b %b%xh+note/<category> <name>=<text>%xn - make a note in a specific category%r%r %xcEDIT NOTES%xn%r%b %b%xh+note <note>=<new text>%xn[space(5)]- change the text on a note, removes approval%r%b %b%xh+notemove <note>=<category>%xn - move a note to a new category, keeps approval%r%b %b%xh+note/<category> <note>=<new text>%xn - change the text of a note into%r[space(40)]a new category, removes approval%r%b %b%xh+notestatus <note>=PRIVATE|PUBLIC%xn%b - make a note in-/visible to others%r%r %xcSHOW NOTES%xn%r%b %b%xh+noteprove <note>=<target(s)>%xn - show any note to a list of targets%r[space(33)]- (names or dbrefs separated by commas)%r%r details and more in %xh+help notes2%xn (and beyond)

name: C_NOTES2 Function
codeTemplate: &C_NOTES2 #data-help=Set Character Notes//%xn%b%xcNOTES 2: Some Explanations%xn (part 1 - categories & targets)%r%r The notes system can be complex. Approval, public notes, hidden categories,%r multiple targets and so on. So we're going to dig in.%r%r %xcCATEGORIES%xn%r There are multiple categories that notes can go into to make it easier for%r Characters and Directors to sort through all the information. There may be%r categories you can't see (mainly "important"). This is to keep surprises and%r other storytelling notes on Characters without them knowing.%r%r The current categories you can see are:%r [wrap( elist( iter( sort( lattr( #DATA-MORTAL/notes_* )), get( #DATA-MORTAL/%i0 )),,,,, %xy%0%xn ), 76, l, , , 1 )]%r%r %xcMULTIPLE TARGETS%xn%r You can use a list of targets with +note or +noteprove by putting commas%r between names, aliases, or dbrefs. You can also use '%xchere%xn':%r%b %b %b%xh+note here/*%xn%r%r You can also do this with note name or number. For example, if you wanted to%r move a number of notes to a different category, you could easily:%r%b %b %b%xh+notemove 1,3,4,5=items%xn%r%r '%xc*%xn' stands for "everything", and can be used here, too. The next example is%r seeing all visible notes in Bob's "items" category%r%b %b %b%xh+note/items bob/*%xn%r%r continued in %xh+help notes3%xn (visibility & approval)

You can also use '%xchere%xn':%r%b %b %b%xh+note here/*%xn%r%r You can also do this with note name or number. For example, if you wanted to%r move a number of notes to a different category, you could easily:%r%b %b %b%xh+notemove 1,3,4,5=items%xn%r%r '%xc*%xn' stands for "everything", and can be used here, too. name: C_NOTES3 Function
codeTemplate: &C_NOTES3 #data-help=Set Character Notes//%xn%b%xcNOTES 3: Some Explanations%xn (part 2 - visibility & approval)%r%r %xcVISIBILITY%xn%r When you create a note it is made PRIVATE so that only you and your Director%r can see it. Occasionally you'll want to allow others to see it, so you can%r make it PUBLIC with the %xh+notestatus%xn command.%r%r %xcAPPROVAL%xn%r Notes can hold a lot of information that can be used in the game and for this%r a Director needs to okay it. They do this with the %xh+notestatus%xn command. This%r does not lock a note from being edited, but if you use %xh+note%xn to change the%r text of a note, it will remove the approval, if any, on it.%r%r finished in %xh+help notes4%xn (command aliases)
examples: &C_NOTES3 #data-help=Set Character Notes//%xn%b%xcNOTES 3: Some Explanations%xn (part 2 - visibility & approval)%r%r %xcVISIBILITY%xn%r When you create a note it is made PRIVATE so that only you and your Director%r can see it. Occasionally you'll want to allow others to see it, so you can%r make it PUBLIC with the %xh+notestatus%xn command.%r%r %xcAPPROVAL%xn%r Notes can hold a lot of information that can be used in the game and for this%r a Director needs to okay it. They do this with the %xh+notestatus%xn command. This%r does not lock a note from being edited, but if you use %xh+note%xn to change the%r text of a note, it will remove the approval, if any, on it.%r%r finished in %xh+help notes4%xn (command aliases)

codeTemplate: &C_NOTES4 #data-help=Set Character Notes//%xn%b%xcNOTES 4: Some Explanations%xn (part 3 - command aliases)%r%r %xcCOMMAND ALIASES%xn%r Some people come from other parts of the hobby and so there are multiple ways%r to run these commands. Here's a list.%r%r %xh+note/prove%xn - same format as +noteprove%r %xh+note/public <note(s)>%xn%r %xh+note/private <note(s)>%xn%r %xh+note/move <note(s)>=<category>%xn%r %xh+note/cat%xn - an alias to %xh+note/move%xn. Also aliased: %xh+notecat%xn%r %xh+note/decompile%xn - same format as +notedecompile%r%r You don't have to remember these, but for those who like switches, switches!%r%r %xh%xx(fin.)%xn

Here are some helpful tips for notes.%r%r For now, if you want to view all of someone's notes, you must use '%xc*%xn' for%r their list of notes. name: C_SELFSTAT Function
codeTemplate: &C_SELFSTAT #data-helpSetting factions+types||%R%b%xh%xySet your Splat first:%xn %xc+help +selfsplat%xn.%R%R%b%xh+selfstat/faction%R%b+selfstat/type%R%b+selfstat/faction <level>=<value>%R%b+selfstat/type <level>=<value>%xn%R%R%bThis variant of the %xc+selfstat%xn command allows listing and setting your character's specific Splat's Factions, subfactions and subtypes of said Splat.%R%R%b%xhFactions%xn are usually political or ideological groups, while the %xhTypes%xn have more to do with the Splat's 'biology' - Metis born, Kithain, Vampire vs. Ghoul etc.%R%b%xyNOTE:%xn Some splats like the Mages have types like 'Mage' for true mages, 'Sorceror' or 'Mortal' for mere Acolytes settable.%R%R%T%xc1)%xn Type %xc+selfstat/faction%xn and/or %xc+selfstat/type%xn. It will list the base %xhfactions%xn and %xhtypes%xn you can set for your splat. These are the %xhfirst level%xn of the faction/type hierarchy.%R%R%T%xc2)%xn Set the %xhfaction%xn and/or %xhtype%xn you want with %xc+selfstat/type 1=<name>%xn and %xc+selfstat/faction 1=<name>.%R%R%T3)%xn type %xc+selfstat/faction%xn or %xc+selfstat/type%xn again. It will now show you the %xhsecond level%xn choices as well.%R%R%T%xc4)%xn Set your second level in the hierarchy with %xc+selfstat/faction 2=<name>%xn or %xc+selfstat/type 2=<name>%xn.%R%R%T%xc5)%xn Repeat above, going down the levels of the hierarchy until everything is set. Essentially the deeper you go, the more specific things get.%R%TA simple example is a player only being able to set the %xh'NWO' level 2 Faction%xn, if %xhLevel 1 Faction 'Technocracy'%xn was set. And the Technocracy can only be set on Mages :)%R%R%bTo %xhempty%xn a setting, just leave the <value> %xhblank%xn. %xc+selfstat/faction 2=%xn would empty your second level choice.%R%R%T%xh%xyAfter setting your faction/subtypes, set your character stats:%xn See %xc+help +selfstat2%xn.%R
examples: &C_SELFSTAT #data-helpSetting factions+types||%R%b%xh%xySet your Splat first:%xn %xc+help +selfsplat%xn.%R%R%b%xh+selfstat/faction%R%b+selfstat/type%R%b+selfstat/faction <level>=<value>%R%b+selfstat/type <level>=<value>%xn%R%R%bThis variant of the %xc+selfstat%xn command allows listing and setting your character's specific Splat's Factions, subfactions and subtypes of said Splat.%R%R%b%xhFactions%xn are usually political or ideological groups, while the %xhTypes%xn have more to do with the Splat's 'biology' - Metis born, Kithain, Vampire vs. Ghoul etc.%R%b%xyNOTE:%xn Some splats like the Mages have types like 'Mage' for true mages, 'Sorceror' or 'Mortal' for mere Acolytes settable.%R%R%T%xc1)%xn Type %xc+selfstat/faction%xn and/or %xc+selfstat/type%xn. It will list the base %xhfactions%xn and %xhtypes%xn you can set for your splat. These are the %xhfirst level%xn of the faction/type hierarchy.%R%R%T%xc2)%xn Set the %xhfaction%xn and/or %xhtype%xn you want with %xc+selfstat/type 1=<name>%xn and %xc+selfstat/faction 1=<name>.%R%R%T3)%xn type %xc+selfstat/faction%xn or %xc+selfstat/type%xn again. It will now show you the %xhsecond level%xn choices as well.%R%R%T%xc4)%xn Set your second level in the hierarchy with %xc+selfstat/faction 2=<name>%xn or %xc+selfstat/type 2=<name>%xn.%R%R%T%xc5)%xn Repeat above, going down the levels of the hierarchy until everything is set. Essentially the deeper you go, the more specific things get.%R%TA simple example is a player only being able to set the %xh'NWO' level 2 Faction%xn, if %xhLevel 1 Faction 'Technocracy'%xn was set. And the Technocracy can only be set on Mages :)%R%R%bTo %xhempty%xn a setting, just leave the <value> %xhblank%xn. %xc+selfstat/faction 2=%xn would empty your second level choice.%R%R%T%xh%xyAfter setting your faction/subtypes, set your character stats:%xn See %xc+help +selfstat2%xn.%R

name: PLUS_C_SELFSTAT Function
codeTemplate:
&PLUS_C_SELFSTAT #data-help1


&C_SELFSTAT2 #data-help=Setting char. stats||%b%xh+selfstat <statname>=<value>%R%b+selfstat <statcategory>/<statname>=<value>%xn%R%R%bThe %xc+selfstat%xn command allows you to set up your character's sheet stats. This command can be used while you are still unapproved and inside the %xhOOC Area%xn.%R%R%T%xc<statname>%xn - The name of the stat to set.%R%R%T%xc<statcategory>%xn - The category of stat to set. 'general', 'physical', or 'merit' for example. %xh%xyAlways try setting stats without a category first%xn. You only need to specify the category if the stat name itself is too ambiguous for the system to figure out, and the system will %xhtell you%xn the categories it found the ambiguous names in. %R%R%T%xc<Value>%xn - The value of the stat to set. Either numerical, or text.%R%R%bThe +selfstat command is smart enough to handle %xhshorthand%xn - you can type %xc+selfstat stam=3%xn or %xc+selfstat dex=3%xn and it will try to figure out the according stat.%R%bIn case the command cannot figure out the stat, it will tell you what stats your input is matching, so you can be more precise.%R%R%TIf you want to %xcdelete%xn a stat, simply leave its value empty.%R%R[center(Once you are done with CG\, type [ansi(hy,+approveme)] to start the approval process!,79)]%R%R%bIf you ever want to completely wipe and re-CG your character, you can use %xh%xr+resetmeplease%xn. %xh%xyIMPORTANT%xn: This will wipe all your %xh%xrStats, notes and splat affiliation!%xn. You need to type %xh%xy&RESET ME=1%xn first!%R%R
examples:
&PLUS_C_SELFSTAT #data-help1


&C_SELFSTAT2 #data-help=Setting char. stats||%b%xh+selfstat <statname>=<value>%R%b+selfstat <statcategory>/<statname>=<value>%xn%R%R%bThe %xc+selfstat%xn command allows you to set up your character's sheet stats. This command can be used while you are still unapproved and inside the %xhOOC Area%xn.%R%R%T%xc<statname>%xn - The name of the stat to set.%R%R%T%xc<statcategory>%xn - The category of stat to set. 'general', 'physical', or 'merit' for example. %xh%xyAlways try setting stats without a category first%xn. You only need to specify the category if the stat name itself is too ambiguous for the system to figure out, and the system will %xhtell you%xn the categories it found the ambiguous names in. %R%R%T%xc<Value>%xn - The value of the stat to set. Either numerical, or text.%R%R%bThe +selfstat command is smart enough to handle %xhshorthand%xn - you can type %xc+selfstat stam=3%xn or %xc+selfstat dex=3%xn and it will try to figure out the according stat.%R%bIn case the command cannot figure out the stat, it will tell you what stats your input is matching, so you can be more precise.%R%R%TIf you want to %xcdelete%xn a stat, simply leave its value empty.%R%R[center(Once you are done with CG\, type [ansi(hy,+approveme)] to start the approval process!,79)]%R%R%bIf you ever want to completely wipe and re-CG your character, you can use %xh%xr+resetmeplease%xn. %xh%xyIMPORTANT%xn: This will wipe all your %xh%xrStats, notes and splat affiliation!%xn. You need to type %xh%xy&RESET ME=1%xn first!%R%R

name: D_SETSTAT Function
codeTemplate: &D_SETSTAT #data-help=Setting char. stats||%b%xh%xw+setstat <player>/<statname>=<value>%R%b+setstat <player>/<statcategory>/<statname>=<value>%xn%R%R%TThis command can be used by Producers and Directors alike to set character stats on specific players.%R%R%T%xh<player>%xn - The player to set the stats on.%R%R%T%xh<statname>%xn - The name of the stat to set.%R%R%T%xh<statcategory>%xn - The category of stat to set. Examples are 'general', 'physical', or 'merit'.%R%R%T%xh<Value>%xn - The value of the stat to set. Either numerical, or a string.%R%R%R%TTo set stats, either the stat's name, or a combination of stat name and its category can be used. The +setstat command is smart enough to handle shorthand - it will try to guess the stat that you mean. For example, %xc'dex'%xn as the stat's name will figure out that you mean %xc'Dexterity'%xn.%R%TIn case the command cannot figure out the stat, it will tell you what stats your input is matching, so you can be more precise.%R%R%TIn a case when the full stat name is still too ambiguous, you can additionally specify the %xccategory%xn of the stat. 'General' (or just 'gen') works for general stats like the Full Name, Demeanor and such. 'Pools' gets used for things like the amount of Blood Points, etc. When in doubt, see what the command tells you when it comes to ambiguous stat names.%R%R%TIf you want to %xcdelete%xn a stat, simply leave its value empty.%R%R%T%xcNote:%xn Only a Producer or Director who is responsible for that player's current set Splat can use +setstat on the player.%R%R%t%xh%xyFor setting Specialties, Factions, and Subtypes, see +help +setstat2!%xn%R
examples: &D_SETSTAT #data-help=Setting char. stats||%b%xh%xw+setstat <player>/<statname>=<value>%R%b+setstat <player>/<statcategory>/<statname>=<value>%xn%R%R%TThis command can be used by Producers and Directors alike to set character stats on specific players.%R%R%T%xh<player>%xn - The player to set the stats on.%R%R%T%xh<statname>%xn - The name of the stat to set.%R%R%T%xh<statcategory>%xn - The category of stat to set. Examples are 'general', 'physical', or 'merit'.%R%R%T%xh<Value>%xn - The value of the stat to set. Either numerical, or a string.%R%R%R%TTo set stats, either the stat's name, or a combination of stat name and its category can be used. The +setstat command is smart enough to handle shorthand - it will try to guess the stat that you mean. For example, %xc'dex'%xn as the stat's name will figure out that you mean %xc'Dexterity'%xn.%R%TIn case the command cannot figure out the stat, it will tell you what stats your input is matching, so you can be more precise.%R%R%TIn a case when the full stat name is still too ambiguous, you can additionally specify the %xccategory%xn of the stat. 'General' (or just 'gen') works for general stats like the Full Name, Demeanor and such. 'Pools' gets used for things like the amount of Blood Points, etc. When in doubt, see what the command tells you when it comes to ambiguous stat names.%R%R%TIf you want to %xcdelete%xn a stat, simply leave its value empty.%R%R%T%xcNote:%xn Only a Producer or Director who is responsible for that player's current set Splat can use +setstat on the player.%R%R%t%xh%xyFor setting Specialties, Factions, and Subtypes, see +help +setstat2!%xn%R

name: D_SETSTAT2 Function
codeTemplate: &D_SETSTAT2 #data-help=Setting factions+types||%b%xh+setstat\[/faction /type\] <player>%R%b+setstat\[/faction /type\] <player>/<level>=<value>%xn%R%R%TThis variant of the %xc+setstat%xn command allows listing and setting a player's specific Splat's Factions, subfactions and subtypes of said Splat.%R%R%T%xhFactions%xn are usually political or ideological groups, while the %xhTypes%xn have more to do with the Splat's 'biology' - Metis born, Kithain, Vampire vs. Ghoul etc.%R%TSome splats like the Mages have %xhno Types%xn settable.%R%R%T%xc*%xn The format %xc+setstat\[/faction /type\] <player>%xn will list all available factions or subtypes for that player, according to their splat.%R%T%xc*%xn Each listing will show the different %xhLevels%xn available.%R%T%xc*%xn You can only set a level if the lower level %xhis%xn set, and %xh%xrno%xn higher level is set.%R%T%xc*%xn The listing shows what higher (i.e. more specific) levels can be set based on those before. A simple example is one only being able to set the %xh'NWO' level 2 Faction%xn, if %xhLevel 1 Faction 'Technocracy'%xn was set. And the Technocracy can only be set on Mages :)%R%R%TThe second format, %xc+setstat\[/faction /type\] <player>/<level>=<value>%xn will %xhset%xn the according Faction or Subtype of that player's stat.%R%TTo %xhempty%xn a setting, just leave the <value> %xhblank%xn%R%R%xh%b+setstat/spec <player>/<statname>=\[!\]<specialty>%R%b+setstat/spec <player>/<statcategory>/<statname>=\[!\]<specialty>%xn%R%R%TTo set a specialty on any given stat is like setting a stat's value. Do not use the %xc!%xn when setting; use that only when you want to remove a specialty from the list of specialties for that stat. e.g.:%r%t%xcset:%xn %b +setstat/spec bob/brawl=boxing%r%t%xcunset:%xn +setstat/spec bob/drive=!manual transmission%r%r%tCurrently only works on: Traits, mage Spheres, and werewolf Gifts/Ways.
examples: &D_SETSTAT2 #data-help=Setting factions+types||%b%xh+setstat\[/faction /type\] <player>%R%b+setstat\[/faction /type\] <player>/<level>=<value>%xn%R%R%TThis variant of the %xc+setstat%xn command allows listing and setting a player's specific Splat's Factions, subfactions and subtypes of said Splat.%R%R%T%xhFactions%xn are usually political or ideological groups, while the %xhTypes%xn have more to do with the Splat's 'biology' - Metis born, Kithain, Vampire vs. Ghoul etc.%R%TSome splats like the Mages have %xhno Types%xn settable.%R%R%T%xc*%xn The format %xc+setstat\[/faction /type\] <player>%xn will list all available factions or subtypes for that player, according to their splat.%R%T%xc*%xn Each listing will show the different %xhLevels%xn available.%R%T%xc*%xn You can only set a level if the lower level %xhis%xn set, and %xh%xrno%xn higher level is set.%R%T%xc*%xn The listing shows what higher (i.e. more specific) levels can be set based on those before. A simple example is one only being able to set the %xh'NWO' level 2 Faction%xn, if %xhLevel 1 Faction 'Technocracy'%xn was set. And the Technocracy can only be set on Mages :)%R%R%TThe second format, %xc+setstat\[/faction /type\] <player>/<level>=<value>%xn will %xhset%xn the according Faction or Subtype of that player's stat.%R%TTo %xhempty%xn a setting, just leave the <value> %xhblank%xn%R%R%xh%b+setstat/spec <player>/<statname>=\[!\]<specialty>%R%b+setstat/spec <player>/<statcategory>/<statname>=\[!\]<specialty>%xn%R%R%TTo set a specialty on any given stat is like setting a stat's value. Do not use the %xc!%xn when setting; use that only when you want to remove a specialty from the list of specialties for that stat. e.g.:%r%t%xcset:%xn %b +setstat/spec bob/brawl=boxing%r%t%xcunset:%xn +setstat/spec bob/drive=!manual transmission%r%r%tCurrently only works on: Traits, mage Spheres, and werewolf Gifts/Ways.
